newsitem.title: BRUNEI: Sultan of Brunei sees plot to smear country image.
newsitem.headline: Sultan of Brunei sees plot to smear country image.

text.p: Brunei's Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah said defamatory accusations were smearing Brunei's image and he urged the nation to be vigilant against such attacks.
"We have been implicated by slander and defamation that could very well undermine the respect and trust the people have placed on us," the ruler of the oil-rich country on Borneo island said.

"Hence we must remain vigilant against the destructive forces, that try to confuse the general perception of the people," said the sultan, believed to be the world's richest man, in a radio address to mark Friday's Moslem festival of Eid al-Adha, the Feast of Sacrifice.
The sultan has been the target of allegations by a former Miss USA beauty queen, who accused him of trying to turn her into his "sexual toy".
A suit was filed in U.S. District Court in Los Angeles in January by Shannon Marketic, 26.
In March, the sultan categorically denied the allegations. A statement from the Brunei prime minister's office said the sultan "has never been acquainted with, nor met, Ms Marketic".
Marketic's lawsuit said she was among seven young women sent to Brunei by a Los Angeles talent agency.

Transported to the sultan's palace, she alleges that she and the other women were "forcibly detained" in Brunei and forced to dance at late night parties while being groped and verbally abused by the sultan and his guests.

The sultan, who is also the nation's prime minister, did not specifically mention Marketic or the lawsuit in the radio address, but he said allegations made against his country were "worse than murder".
"Apparently Brunei's good image, its strong hold on Islam, the virtuous values and traditions it upholds has made some people uneasy," the sultan said in the Thursday night speech.
He also said the palace, in accordance with Islamic tenets, has also been a royal residence intended for decent and righteous activities.
He said the palace had hosted many Koran readings and had welcomed the haj pilgrims who have come to seek blessings of the royal family.
